Articles.Content: So I'm trying to build a space station on the ground before I lift it. My starting point is the cupola with the science center next. I then connect an I-beam (200) to the science just below the side hatch. But then I'm unable to connect a hitchhiker module to the end of the i-beam. What gives? I did manage to connect a mk-2 fuel tank. Similarly, I can't attach a fuel tank onto the BZ-52 radial attachment point in an intelligent manner. It never wants to snap onto the connection point, rather it attempts to attach the tank sideways. Suggestions?

If you hold the mod key (Alt in Windoze) while attaching, it forces node attachment rather than surface attachment.

Happy landings!

Great! That helps for the radial!

I was able to connect a Rockomax X200-8 Fuel tank to the end of the I-beam and place the hitchhiker on top of it. So it appears to be specific to the hitchhiker. Bug or WAD?
Sounds weird. The difference between fuel tank and hitchhiker is that fuel tanks can be surface attached while hitchhiker cannot. Did you surface attached the fuel tank?
I surfaced attached the tank. I could not surface attach the hitchhiker. I don't know why that should work that way.

and that's the moment Cubic Octagonal Strut becomes invaluable.

You clip it (rotate) into the part and it creates a node at that point.

If you save the part as subassembly with the strut leading to the root, you can attach that part by it radially to anything.

> 
> I surfaced attached the tank. I could not surface attach the hitchhiker. I don't know why that should work that way.

Yeah, that's by design. Some parts allow surface-attach, others don't.

Here's the config for the hitchhiker:

[http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts/Command/hitchhikerStorageContainer/hitchikerStorageContainer.cfg](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts/Command/hitchhikerStorageContainer/hitchikerStorageContainer.cfg)

...note the line that says:

attachRules = 1,**0**,1,1,0

Per the [config file documentation](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/CFG_File_Documentation#Attachment_rules), it's that 0 in the second slot that's the smoking gun here-- it says "do not allow surface attach."

Sharpy has pointed out a way to do this with a cubic octagonal strut.

Another approach would be to attach something that *is* surface-attachable, and then attach your hitchhiker vertically above or below that.
